column4: How can I move files between Ubuntu and installtion of Windows on VirtualBox?
try #vbox (also the official documentation explains iirc)
did you check the vbox official documentation?
I've got nano open, but what next? Read file?
no.  Close nano.  Open it by doing: nano ~/.gnomerc, then type "WINDOW_MANAGER=metacity", then save and exit
When I attempt to open gnomerc with nano, it says file not found in /root/
you didn't type what I told you to type then
why do you want to use X in recovery mode?  Why are you in recovery mode?
I don't want to use x in recovery mode, and i'm in recovery mode because I cannot use regular mode (it is simply a white screen)
ok.  Then replace "~" with "~YOUR_USERNAME" in my command
I did as you said and starts ubuntu normally, but it is still a white screen
sorry, I had to go do something. My username is miguel
